titles.title: Senior Citizens' Tax Relief Act of 2003
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the 1993 income tax increase on Social Security benefits, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 1/27/2003--Introduced. Senior Citizens' Tax Relief Act of 2003 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal the 85 percent (second tier) taxation of Social Security and Railroad Retirement benefits. Appropriates, from the general fund, to the Hospital Insurance Trust Fund amounts equal to the reduction in revenue lost because of the repeal.
